pull.title: policy: ephemeral dust followups
pull.body:
Follow-up to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30239

Here are the parent PR's comments that should be addressed by this PR:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30239/files#r1834529646

Time to sweep the ephemeral top 9 commits

events.message: CheckEphemeralSpends: only compute txid of tx when needed

They all happen within a few seconds of fuzzing. The errors are non-deterministic, so the inputs aren't of much use unfortunately 😕  I'm still looking for the bug, but will likely be easier for you.
@marcofleon to be clear this is happening on master or follow-up?
ok replicated on this PR, I'll track it down
Yeah not on master, just this PR.

events.message: Rename CheckValidEphemeralTx to PreCheckEphemeralTx
Have HasDust and PreCheckValidEphemeralTx take CTransaction
Use std::ranges for ephemeral policy checks
Implement GetDust to replace HasDust, use where appropriate
ephemeral policy: IWYU
ephemeral policy doxygen cleanup
bench: remove unnecessary CMTxn constructors

unit test: assert txid returned on CheckEphemeralSpends failures

Simplify nullopt checks
unit test: make dust index less magical
fuzz: remove dangling reference to GetEntry
fuzz: explain package eval coin tracking better
fuzz: Directly place transactions in vector
func: cleanup test_dustrelay comments
func: cleanup reorg test comment
fuzz: remove unused TransactionsDelta validation interface
fuzz: use optional status instead of should_rbf_eph_spend
fuzz: package_eval: move last_tx inside txn ctor
unit test: adapt to changing MAX_DUST_OUTPUTS_PER_TX
RPC: only enforce dust rules on priority when standardness active
func: slight elaboration on submitpackage restriction
func: rename test_free_relay to test_no_minrelay_fee
CheckEphemeralSpends: no need to iterate inputs if no parent dust
unit test: ephemeral_tests is using a dust relay rate, not minrelay
func: add note about lack of 1P1C propagation in tree submitpackage
CheckEphemeralSpends: return boolean, and set child state and txid outparams
fuzz: package_eval: let fuzzer run out input in main tx creation loop
functional: only generate required blocks for test

events.body:
Reviewed 5679f398e2a3ab8315d39ee674ccb8ad6a8f73c7

Especially like the refactor of `CheckEphemeralSpends()` with less surprising return/out-values.

Good to see `LIMITED_WHILE(fuzzed_data_provider.remaining_bytes() > 0` in more places than I suggested.

Suggested changes aside from inline comments:

### 03ec3f6230f440b264abe3aa42a57fdd29bd3ba3 commit message

```diff
- Implement GetDust to replace HasDust, use where appropriate
+ Move+rename GetDustIndexes -> GetDust to replace HasDust, use where appropriate
```

### Deduplicate `assert_mempool_contents()`

As [pointed out by theStack & me](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30239#discussion_r1825278134):
```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/mempool_package_rbf.py b/test/functional/mempool_package_rbf.py
index a5b8fa5f87..14194f9e1a 100755
--- a/test/functional/mempool_package_rbf.py
+++ b/test/functional/mempool_package_rbf.py
@@ -19,6 +19,7 @@ from test_framework.wallet import (
     DEFAULT_FEE,
     MiniWallet,
 )
+from test_framework import mempool_util
 
 MAX_REPLACEMENT_CANDIDATES = 100
 
@@ -37,15 +38,7 @@ class PackageRBFTest(BitcoinTestFramework):
         ]] * self.num_nodes
 
     def assert_mempool_contents(self, expected=None):
-        """Assert that all transactions in expected are in the mempool,
-        and no additional ones exist.
-        """
-        if not expected:
-            expected = []
-        mempool = self.nodes[0].getrawmempool(verbose=False)
-        assert_equal(len(mempool), len(expected))
-        for tx in expected:
-            assert tx.rehash() in mempool
+        mempool_util.assert_mempool_contents(self, self.nodes[0], expected, sync=False)
 
     def create_simple_package(self, parent_coin, parent_fee=DEFAULT_FEE, child_fee=DEFAULT_CHILD_FEE, heavy_child=False):
         """Create a 1 parent 1 child package using the coin passed in as the parent's input. The
```

### + Sanity check for `assert_mempool_contents()`

Could add sanity check if passing same tx twice in `expected` (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30239#discussion_r1831120099)
```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/test_framework/mempool_util.py b/test/functional/test_framework/mempool_util.py
index e04ae914cc..72da52d957 100644
--- a/test/functional/test_framework/mempool_util.py
+++ b/test/functional/test_framework/mempool_util.py
@@ -30,6 +30,9 @@ def assert_mempool_contents(test_framework, node, expected=None, sync=True):
         test_framework.sync_mempools()
     if not expected:
         expected = []
+    else:
+        # Sanity check that elements are unique.
+        assert_equal(len(expected), len(set(expected)))
     mempool = node.getrawmempool(verbose=False)
     assert_equal(len(mempool), len(expected))
     for tx in expected:
```

```suggestion
            out_child_state.Invalid(TxValidationResult::TX_MEMPOOL_POLICY, "missing-ephemeral-spends",
```

comments.body:
perf nit: Could remove this line if using `.insert` and checking the return value instead of `.contains` above as suggested here https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30239#discussion_r1831063128.

The current version is slightly easier to read but does an *extra lookup*. I understand if you want to leave as-is for readability as the perf-hit is probably negligible.

Thinking back to [discussion](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30239#discussion_r1831104732) around how limiting prioritizetransaction for miners could backfire on the ecosystem in previous PR.

Encouraging miners to run with `-acceptnonstdtxn` means all *relayfee* limits for other transactions are effectively zero. But standardness touches upon other aspects of transactions as well (with more to be added in the future). So this is worse than only pushing miners to zero out *relayfee*-args/settings. This if-block should probably not have been added in the main PR in the first place.

nit: Could emplace movable `CTransaction`, apologies for not including it in my original suggestion.
```suggestion
            txs.emplace_back([&] {
```

nit: (Resolved in later commit) - `.value_or(null_txid)` seems unnecessary? Suggestion:
```C++
    BOOST_CHECK_EQUAL(CheckEphemeralSpends({grandparent_tx_1, dust_non_spend, dust_spend}, minrelay, pool), dust_non_spend_txid);
```
Changing to that convention makes the introduction of `null_txid` pointless.
